org.apache.reef.io.checkpoint.fs

Class FSCheckpointService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.reef.io.checkpoint.fs.FSCheckpointService

    CheckpointService

    public class FSCheckpointService
extends Object
implements CheckpointService
    A FileSystem based CheckpointService.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public CheckpointService.CheckpointWriteChannel create()
                                                throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: CheckpointService
        This method creates a checkpoint and provide a channel to write to it. The name/location of the checkpoint are unknown to the user as of this time, in fact, the CheckpointID is not released to the user until commit is called. This makes enforcing atomicity of writes easy.
        Specified by:
        create in interface CheckpointService
        Returns:
        a CheckpointWriteChannel that can be used to write to the checkpoint
        Throws:
        IOException

      • open

        public CheckpointService.CheckpointReadChannel open(CheckpointID id)
                                             throws IOException,
                                                    InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: CheckpointService
        Given a CheckpointID returns a reading channel.
        Specified by:
        open in interface CheckpointService
        Parameters:
        id - CheckpointID for the checkpoint to be opened
        Returns:
        a CheckpointReadChannel
        Throws:
        IOException
        InterruptedException

      • commit

        public CheckpointID commit(CheckpointService.CheckpointWriteChannel ch)
                    throws IOException,
                           InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: CheckpointService
        Used to finalize and existing checkpoint. It returns the CheckpointID that can be later used to access (read-only) this checkpoint. This guarantees atomicity of the checkpoint.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface CheckpointService
        Parameters:
        ch - the CheckpointWriteChannel to commit
        Returns:
        a CheckpointID
        Throws:
        IOException
        InterruptedException

      • abort

        public void abort(CheckpointService.CheckpointWriteChannel ch)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: CheckpointService
        Dual to commit, it aborts the current checkpoint. Garbage collection choices are left to the implementation. The CheckpointID is not generated nor released to the user so the checkpoint is not accessible.
        Specified by:
        abort in interface CheckpointService
        Parameters:
        ch - the CheckpointWriteChannel to abort
        Throws:
        IOException

      • delete

        public boolean delete(CheckpointID id)
               throws IOException,
                      InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: CheckpointService
        It discards an existing checkpoint identified by its CheckpointID.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface CheckpointService
        Parameters:
        id - CheckpointID for the checkpoint to be deleted
        Returns:
        a boolean confirming success of the deletion
        Throws:
        IOException
        InterruptedException
